content:
CHRISTIAN  RELIGIOUS  KNOWLEDGE 2000  
 
1. Joseph called the name of his first born Manasseh, 
meaning God has 
A. made him forget his hardship and his father’s house. 
B. made him fruitful in the land of his affliction. 
C. rescued him from the hands of Potiphar 
D. made him not to forget his brothers and his house 
hold 
 
2. “…Now therefore lighten the hard service of your fa 
ther upon us, and we will serve you.” This request was 
made to Rehoboam because 
A. the people had another person in mind 
B. the people wanted to test his wisdom 
C. of an impending revolt 
D. the people wanted some relief. 
 
3. “You are the man…’’ 
This statement by Nathan made David immediately 
A. order him out of the palace 
B. order the killing of the child 
C. confess and ask for forgiveness 
D. abdicate his throne. 
 
4. One  of the  consequences  of 
Saul’s disobedience was that 
A. the Philistines killed him 
B he killed himself 
C the Amalekites killed him 
D his armour bearer killed him. 
 
5. “…The Lord will fight for you, and you have only to be 
still.” This statement was made by Moses when the 
A. Egyptians were pursuing the Isrealites before the 
Red Sea. 
B. Isrealitis were standing before Joshua 
C. Isrealites were standing before King Pharaoh. 
D. Isrealitis’ charious were crossing the Rea Sea. 
 
6. God told Solomon that He would surely tear the 
kingdom from him and give it to his 
A. son   B. brother C.servant D. army commander. 
 
7. Why did Job kill Abner? 
A. He wanted to avenge the death of his brother. 
B. He feared that Abner would take over his post. 
C. Abner only came to deceive David. 
D. He was an enemy who came to spy on David. 
 
8. When God told Abraham that Sarah would have a child, 
Abraham laughed because 
A. he already had a child by Hagar 
B. his wife Sarah was barren 
C. his wife was too old to have a child 
D. he was amused by the promise. 
 
9. In the beginning, God created the 
A. heavens and the earth 
B. animals and the birds 
C. light and the darkness 
D. water and the dry land. 
10. Moses fled Egypt to the land of Midian because 
A. he was afraid that his crime would be made known 
B. Pharaoh wanted to kill him for the crime he had 
committed. 
C. his countryman asked if he would also kill him 
D. he had killed an Egyptian and buried him in the 
sand. 
 
11. The LORD sent Samuel to Saul to go and destroy the 
Amalekites because 
A. they opposed Isreal on their way out of Egypt 
B. they were idolaters 
C. they disobeyed God 
D. their land had been given to Isreal after the battle. 
 
12. In the creation story, man was permitted to 
A. plant fruit trees for food 
B. water the garden 
C. make garments of skin 
D. name all the creatures. 
 
13. God instructed Moses on Mount Sinai to 
A. speak to the rock B. strike the rock 
C. consecrate the people D. pray for the people. 
 
14. ‘’’…If it be so, our God whom we serve is able to deliver 
us from the burning fiery furnance…’’’ The statement 
above portrays Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego as 
A. men of faith B. disillusioned men 
C. stub born men D. men with pride. 
 
15. Prohet Ezekiel described the house of Isreal as having a 
hard forehead and stubborn heart because the people 
A. lacked confidence in him 
B. refused to listen to him 
C. had taken God for granted 
D. had endured suffering. 
 
16. ‘And the LORD God appointed a plant, and made it 
come up over Jonah…’ The statement above taught 
Jonah that 
A. the repentance of the Ninevites would be short- 
lived 
B. God is sovereign 
C. his assignment would not last long 
D. God is merciful. 
 
17. “Why is your spirit so vexed that you eat no food?” 
The addressee was sad because 
A. Naboth refused to give him his vineyard 
B. he had an encounter with Elijah 
C. his inheritance had been taken away 
D. Jezebel refused to speak to him. 
 
18. Isaiah teaches that the LORD wants His people to 
demonstrate holiness by 
A. observing religious festivals 
B. offering more sacrifices 
C. doing justice and not evil
